items.title: Inflation makes case for rate cut, but growth indicators are benign
items.summary: Inflation has dipped to its lowest point in eight years, opening the door for potential interest rate cuts from the Reserve Bank of India, with analysts suggesting a reduction of 25 to 50 basis points. However, uncertainty looms as the economic growth outlook and trade issues remain in flux.

items.title: Electronic toll collection set to cross ₹80,000 cr this FY
items.summary: This financial year, India's electronic toll collection is poised to exceed ₹80,000 crore, with the first half showcasing a robust 18.6% surge in figures. Anticipations for heightened freight movement loom large as more tolled highways emerge and traffic surges. To add to this momentum, the government is rolling out initiatives designed to enhance benefits for toll payers.

items.title: IMF raises India’s FY26 GDP growth forecast to 6.6%, trims FY27 projection by 20 bps
items.summary: However, the IMF lowered India’s growth forecast for the 2026-27 fiscal year by 0.2 percentage points to 6.2 per cent.

items.title: GJEPC to discuss silver shortage impacting India's jewellery exports
items.summary: With silver prices soaring to unprecedented levels, a severe scarcity has emerged, directly affecting India's silver jewellery exports. The Gem & Jewellery Export Promotion Council is convening with exporters and retailers to brainstorm solutions. Compounding this issue, global demand coupled with stricter US import regulations is leading to reduced supplies.

items.title: Nelco to tap enterprises, govt sectors to bag next-gen satcom service deals
items.summary: Nelco, part of the Tata Power family, is setting its sights on the burgeoning market for satellite communication services aimed at businesses and government entities in India. Although the retail sector grapples with high operational costs, the firm expects a significant uptick in B2B and B2G satellite communication by 2030.

items.title: Swiggy Got 2.2 Lakh Orders In An Hour On Ashtami, Over 99,000 For Sabudana Khichdi During Navratri
items.summary: Between Sep. 22 and Sep. 30, 2025, Swiggy received over 99,200 orders for Sabudana Khichdi, more than 1.03 lakh orders for Vrat Thali, and nearly 70,000 orders for Sabudana Vada.

items.title: Proposal transfer of old shares for small investors in 30 days
items.summary: In a bid to enhance investor experience, the Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority is set to evaluate a proposal that would streamline the transfer process for small investors holding outdated shares. The initiative intends to allow swifter transfers for physical shares worth up to ₹5 lakh and dematerialised shares valued at ₹15 lakh.

items.title: LT Foods set to buy Hungary's Global Green for Rs 25 million
items.summary: LT Foods makes a significant move by acquiring Global Green Europe Kft, a leading Hungarian company specializing in processed and canned foods. This ₹25 million deal orchestrated through its European subsidiary marks LT Foods' strategic entry into the canned food sector, aiming to amplify synergies with its ongoing European initiatives. The acquisition awaits approval from Hungarian FDI authorities.

items.title: Wall Street mixed, banks rally on upbeat results
items.summary: USA-STOCKS/ (UPDATE 5):US STOCKS-Wall Street mixed, banks rally on upbeat results

items.title: Fertiliser companies may get relief as subsidy inversion issue lingers
items.summary: In light of ongoing challenges within the fertiliser sector, the government is actively pursuing strategies to assist companies struggling with working capital. The root of the issue lies in the impact of subsidies on price structures, which inhibits firms from fully claiming input tax credits on their sales.

items.title: CDSCO seeks views on level playing field for new drugs
items.summary: In a significant shift for the pharmaceutical market, India's drug regulator is crafting new legislation regarding drug approvals. Under this proposal, the first entity to introduce a novel drug will be mandated to perform clinical trials, while subsequent entrants will be allowed to forego these tests.

items.title: Metal producers may lose sheen at ferrous counter
items.summary: Metal producers are set for a mixed September quarter. Ferrous companies anticipate weaker margins due to falling steel prices and rising raw material costs. Conversely, non-ferrous producers are expected to see stronger earnings, driven by a rebound in aluminium, zinc, and copper prices.

items.title: Bank of Maharashtra PAT up 23% to ₹1,633 crore on higher net interest income
ReNew Global promoters offer higher price to delist co from Nasdaq
items.summary: This is the second time that the promoters’ consortium of CPPIB, ADIA, Masdar and Sumant Sinha has proposed to buy out the listed shares and take ReNew Global private.

items.title: Textiles, leather & kitchen items exports to US down
items.summary: Indian exports of key goods to the United States saw a significant drop in August. Labour-intensive products like textiles, leather, and jewellery experienced a downturn. This follows the imposition of tariffs by Washington on New Delhi. Shipments of marine products, tyres, and garments also declined. Even kitchen staples like tea and spices faced reduced exports.

items.title: Cloudnine Hospitals leads race to acquire Apollo Cradle
items.summary: Cloudnine Hospitals is stepping into a pivotal role in the maternity and pediatric care sphere, as it engages in advanced discussions to acquire Apollo Cradle and Children's Hospital at a valuation of around ₹1,500 crore. Having signed an exclusivity pact, Cloudnine has kicked off due diligence procedures.

items.title: Retail chains fume at iPhone 17 supply squeeze in peak season
items.summary: Diwali shoppers face disappointment as city retailers report a severe shortage of Apple iPhone 17 series devices. Large chains and local dealers are running out of stock, impacting sales during the crucial festive season. Apple's import strategy is cited as a reason for the limited availability. Local stores are losing customers to online platforms and company-owned outlets.

items.title: PSU Banks' Credit Growth Outperformed Private Lenders: Official
items.summary: This reflects the growing robustness of the banking community, with significant improvements in due diligence, credit underwriting standards, and monitoring mechanisms for project loans.

items.title: Air India pilots declared emergency, forced to divert due to GPS interference over Middle East
items.summary: An Air India flight from Vienna to Delhi diverted to Dubai. GPS interference severely impacted the aircraft's navigation and control systems. Autopilot and other critical functions failed. Pilots had to manually fly the plane. The aircraft later continued to Delhi after systems were reset. This incident highlights growing concerns over GPS signal spoofing affecting global aviation.

items.title: 'Not An Innovator's Business To Become Profitable': Nirmala Sitharaman To IIT Students
items.summary: Further, Sitharaman emphasised that innovators should not worry about non-core business concerns, including regulatory compliance or immediate profitability.

items.title: India, Saudi Arabia identify ready-made garment, technical textiles, man-made fibres as key areas for collaboration
items.summary: India and Saudi Arabia are set to boost textile trade and production through collaboration. Key areas for partnership include ready-made garments, technical textiles, and man-made fibres, leveraging Saudi Arabia's petrochemical strengths and India's manufacturing capabilities. Discussions also focused on promoting sustainability in traditional sectors like handloom and carpets.

items.title: Gold prices may touch Rs 1.3 lakh this Dhanteras, Rs 1.5 lakh by 2026?
items.summary: Gold prices are set for another record-breaking Dhanteras, with prices expected to reach Rs 1.3 lakh per 10 grams this season and Rs 1.5 lakh by early 2026. The rise is being driven by global uncertainty, strong central bank buying, and expectations of monetary easing.

items.title: US, UK launch biggest crackdown on Southeast Asian cybercrime networks tied to human trafficking
items.summary: The United States and United Kingdom have launched the largest coordinated crackdown yet on cybercrime networks operating in Southeast Asia, targeting Cambodia-based syndicates accused of running global investment scams, laundering billions and exploiting trafficked workers.

items.title: Gold surges past $4,100 per ounce driven by possible fed interest rate cut bets
items.summary: Spot gold rose 0.8% to $4,143.17 per ounce as of 12:46 p.m. ET (1646 GMT), after hitting a record high of $4,179.48 earlier in the session.

items.title: US Fed chair Jerome Powell flags concern about sharp slowdown in job creation
items.summary: US Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warned Tuesday that risks to employment had risen in recent months, noting there had been a sharp slowdown of job creation in the world's leading economy. "In this less dynamic and somewhat softer labor market, the downside risks to employment appear to have risen," Powell said, noting that longer-term inflation expectations remained aligned with the Fed's target of two percent.

The company plans to raise Rs 550 crore through a fresh issue of shares. These funds will be utilized for working capital and general corporate needs. The company also has a presence in FMCG products.

Specialised branches are being launched to offer sector-specific financial solutions and drive inclusive growth.

The US economy shows resilience, though geopolitical risks remain a concern.

items.summary: Bharti Telecom raised ₹10,500 crore through two bond issues of ₹5,250 crore each — India’s largest such domestic issue this fiscal. Major mutual funds, insurers, and pension funds subscribed, reflecting strong demand. Proceeds will refinance upcoming debt maturities, with coupons priced slightly below initial guidance.

items.summary: The Shipbuilding Financial Assistance Scheme, with an outlay of Rs 24,736 crore, provides financial support, ship-breaking credit notes, and steers domestic manufacturing through the National Shipbuilding Mission.

However, LG Electronics India made a stellar debut, listing at a 50% premium — the strongest for a billion-dollar IPO since 2021. Analysts say Nifty remains range-bound between 25,000 and 25,300 levels.

The expanded schedule, operating between mid-October and early November, strengthens connectivity across major Indian cities and opens bookings through all official airline channels.

items.title: India at 6th position globally in live branded residence projects: Knight Frank
items.summary: India has secured the 6th position globally for live branded residence projects, contributing 4% to the worldwide supply. The nation also ranks 10th in upcoming projects, representing 2% of future supply. This growth is driven by an expanding affluent population, with nearly 86,000 ultra-rich individuals fueling demand.
